name: QA In Process Line Audit Check List [SMT Area]
description:
Fill in following question with below score
3  -  System/Control in place and acceptable 
2  -  System/Control in place but need minor improvement
1  -  System/Control in place but NOT meeting requirement
0  -  System/Control NOT in place

items.item: Auditor
Auditee
Score
Is the solder paste or epoxy not more than 96 hours usage in line ?
Are components in feeders prepared base on loading list ?
Is the 'Top up component record' recorded correctly and the range value within specification base from BOM & Agile ?
Is there a temperature profile taken then printed for every Friday and every  PT / FAS model?
Is the temperature profile taken within or according to Matrix profile?
Is there a WI displayed for each operator to follow and according model running and with latest rev ?
Does operator understand and works task according to WI ?
Is there a work instruction that states the solder iron temperature and recorded base on product requirement?
Is there solder wire usage according to spec ?
Is there a proper segregation of good and reject units with proper identification labels?
Is there a proper segregation of good and reject units with proper identification labels?
Is there proper identification of reject / on hold units & an available area for its staging?
Have all grounding been checked and recorded ?
Is the daily wristrap checking conducted and recorded ?
Does the operator use wristrap correctly ?
Is the PCBA handled according to ESD procedure ?
Are there non-ESD safe materials near the PCBA?
Are MSD part storage & handling according to MSD procedure?
Is temperature and humidity controlled ?
Are all the sets properly identified & at the correct area ?
Is there proper set arrangement to prevent secondary problem ?
Is there unnecessary materials on the line ?
Is production area cleanliness being controlled well?
Does the working area have sufficient light illumination?
Is the loading list was updated as per ECO?

name: QA In Process Line Audit Check List [ FA Area ]
description:
Fill in following question with below score
3  -  System/Control in place and acceptable 
2  -  System/Control in place but need minor improvement
1  -  System/Control in place but NOT meeting requirement
0  -  System/Control NOT in place

items.item: Auditor
Auditee
Score
Is there WI displayed for each operator and according model running and with latest rev ?
Does WI state part number, usage and location clearly ?
Does operator understand and work follow WI ?
Is there important instruction ( ie caution point, reminder report ) highlighted ?
Does part container have proper indication, and put with correct part inside ?
Does part preparation follow counting system for missing part / extra part early detection ?
Does opr has valid training certificate ?
Does part kept with correct label ( P/N, Qty, Kitting label  )
Does part storage with proper arrangement ?
Does material storage still  within expiration date ?
Does material base on Work order / pick list, [qty,operation code]
Are the available Work order that is Open more than two month?
Have all grounding been checked and recorded ?
Is the daily wristrap checking conducted and recorded ?
Does the operator use wristrap correctly ?
Is the PCBA handled according to ESD procedure ?
Are there non-ESD safe materials near the PCBA?
Is there reject tag & reject / on hold area available near by line ?
Is there proper indication for repaired, unfinished, & rejected set ?
Are all the sets properly identified & at the correct area ?
Is there proper set arrangement to prevent secondary problem ?
Is there unnecessary materials on the line ?
Is production area cleanliness being controlled well?
Does the working area have sufficient light illumination?
Is there screw gap checking using filler gap after screwing ?
Does screw mounted on PCB been counted & marked?
Is there cleaning process before pasting gasket ?
Is there proper arrangement for FANs to prevent damaging ?
Does opr check SN, EPROM, FIS, Mac Address label on the PCBA vs unit ?
Is there safety cover used to protect PCBA from chassis standoff when fitting PCBA to the chassis base ?
Is there proper handling to avoid component on PCB hole positioning damage during fitting PCBA to chassis base and screwing ?
Does on line opr & staff clean from accessories at their hand to prevent secondary reject ?
Does Visual check count screw on the chassis ?
Does visual check using spot light to check foreign mtrl inside unit & pin connector ?
Does visual check perform shaking test ?
